fact_check_explanation_title: Installing defibrillators in schools is not proof that Covid-19 vaccines are unsafe
fact_check_explanation_summary: Defibrillators were being installed in schools prior to the pandemic and there is no evidence linking vaccines to cardiac arrest.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police Scotland says it hasn’t renamed paedophiles as ‘minor attracted people’
fact_check_explanation_summary: It clarified its use of the phrase after it appeared in a report produced by the force.

fact_check_explanation_title: Tilted perspective weather maps are no longer used by the BBC
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post which claims TV has “shrunk Scotland and grown England” by changing its weather maps shows an image of graphics which were replaced in 2018.

fact_check_explanation_title: Aspen card does not give asylum seekers £175 a week
fact_check_explanation_summary: Not every asylum seeker is eligible for support payments, and those that are receive much less than has been claimed on Facebook.

fact_check_explanation_title: BBC didn’t ‘censor’ footage of Brexit march
fact_check_explanation_summary: Thousands of people have shared claims that the BBC censored footage of a People’s Vote march.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaping harms overstated in viral video
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared video on TikTok and Instagram exaggerates and misrepresents the risks of vaping.

fact_check_explanation_title: How wages and pensions in the UK and France compare
fact_check_explanation_summary: A tweet shared more than 5,000 times makes a number of comparisons between France and the UK, many of which need context or are not quite right.

fact_check_explanation_title: Jeff Bezos couldn’t give every Amazon worker £90,000
fact_check_explanation_summary: A bonus suggested by the Labour MP Zarah Sultana would cost more than Mr Bezos’s reported total wealth, let alone any wealth he gained during the pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Earth’s core has not stopped rotating
fact_check_explanation_summary: A study in Nature Geoscience said that the Earth’s inner core might no longer be spinning faster than the rest of the planet—not that it might have stopped spinning altogether.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lines reportedly seen in the sky around Heathrow are contrails, not chemtrails
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post has shared a number of images showing vapour lines from aeroplanes in the sky, and claims that these are in fact “chemtrails”. They aren’t—they’re contrails.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Kraken’ Covid-19 subvariant linked to baseless claims about 5G harms
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post claims that 5G is “harming and killing people”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook offer of free sausage roll and drink at Greggs is not genuine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post shared hundreds of times on social media is not from the bakery chain.
